div.head: TO THE NOBLE AND FERVENT Louer of Religion, Sir GEORGE HASTINGS, Knight.
div.p:
MEEting with this Copy by accidēt, & per using it with obseruation and delight,
J found it too worthy to be buried in obscuritie, or cōfined to one priuate study. And though the reuerend Author, (who is to me, after much inquiry, still vnknowne) for what cause I cannot guesse, did omit to blesse the World with so happy a fruit of his Labours; J presumed to bring it foorth to that light, which otherwise it was likely neuer to haue seene. Ʋpon the hope to make that, which was at
first good, so much the better, by being more publicke and generall Not that it shall lye exposed to sale on euery Booke-sellers stall, but onely bee commended into the hands of some fewe noble and worthy Persons. Among whom, I am principally encouraged by the certaine knowledge of your Zealous affection to such holy Pieces, and Diuine meditations, to Dedicate it
and my selfe to the Patronage of your VVorship not doubting of your gracious respect to so graue a Guest, and free pardon to

closer.signed: Your Worships vnworthy Seruant IOSEPH TAYLOR.
